trans-unit.source: Session state with Azure Redis cache in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Session state with Azure Redis cache in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Cache Service to support ASP.NET session state caching.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Cache Service to support ASP.NET session state caching.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to use the Azure Redis Cache Service for session state.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to use the Azure Redis Cache Service for session state.

trans-unit.source: If your ASP.NET web app uses session state, you will need to configure an external session state provider (either the Redis Cache Service or a SQL Server session state provider).
trans-unit.target: If your ASP.NET web app uses session state, you will need to configure an external session state provider (either the Redis Cache Service or a SQL Server session state provider).

trans-unit.source: If you use session state, and don't use an external provider, you will be limited to one instance of your web app.
trans-unit.target: If you use session state, and don't use an external provider, you will be limited to one instance of your web app.

trans-unit.source: The Redis Cache Service is the fastest and simplest to enable.
trans-unit.target: The Redis Cache Service is the fastest and simplest to enable.

trans-unit.source: Follow <linkText>these directions</linkText><title></title> to create the cache.
trans-unit.target: Follow <linkText>these directions</linkText><title></title> to create the cache.

trans-unit.source: Install the NuGet RedisSessionStateProvider package.
trans-unit.target: Install the NuGet RedisSessionStateProvider package.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to install from the package manager console (Tools > NuGet Package Manager > Package Manager Console):
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to install from the package manager console (Tools > NuGet Package Manager > Package Manager Console):

trans-unit.source: PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Web.RedisSessionStateProvider
trans-unit.target: PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Web.RedisSessionStateProvider

trans-unit.source: To install from Tools > NuGet Package Manager > Manage NugGet Packages for Solution, search for RedisSessionStateProvider.
trans-unit.target: To install from Tools > NuGet Package Manager > Manage NugGet Packages for Solution, search for RedisSessionStateProvider.

trans-unit.source: For more information see the <linkText>NuGet RedisSessionStateProvider page</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Configure the cache client</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see the <linkText>NuGet RedisSessionStateProvider page</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Configure the cache client</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In addition to making assembly references for Cache, the NuGet package adds stub entries in the web.config file.
trans-unit.target: In addition to making assembly references for Cache, the NuGet package adds stub entries in the web.config file.

trans-unit.source: Open the web.config and find the the sessionState element.
trans-unit.target: Open the web.config and find the the sessionState element.

trans-unit.source: Enter the values for host, accessKey, port (the SSL port should be 6380), and set SSL to true.
trans-unit.target: Enter the values for host, accessKey, port (the SSL port should be 6380), and set SSL to true.

trans-unit.source: These values can be obtained from the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title> blade for your cache instance.
trans-unit.target: These values can be obtained from the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title> blade for your cache instance.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Connect to the cache</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Connect to the cache</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the non-SSL port is disabled by default for new caches.
trans-unit.target: Note that the non-SSL port is disabled by default for new caches.

trans-unit.source: For more information about enabling the non-SSL port, see the <linkText>Access Ports</linkText><title></title> section in the <linkText>Configure a cache in Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title> topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information about enabling the non-SSL port, see the <linkText>Access Ports</linkText><title></title> section in the <linkText>Configure a cache in Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title> topic.

trans-unit.source: The following markup shows the changes to the web.config file, specifically the changes to port, host, accessKey, and *ssl.
trans-unit.target: The following markup shows the changes to the web.config file, specifically the changes to port, host, accessKey, and *ssl.

trans-unit.source: The final step is to begin using the Session object in your ASP.NET code.
trans-unit.target: The final step is to begin using the Session object in your ASP.NET code.

trans-unit.source: You add objects to session state by using the Session.Add method.
trans-unit.target: You add objects to session state by using the Session.Add method.

trans-unit.source: This method uses key-value pairs to store items in the session state cache.
trans-unit.target: This method uses key-value pairs to store items in the session state cache.

trans-unit.source: The following code retrieves this value from session state.
trans-unit.target: The following code retrieves this value from session state.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Redis Cache to cache objects in your web app.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Redis Cache to cache objects in your web app.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see <linkText>MVC movie app with Azure Redis Cache in 15 minutes</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see <linkText>MVC movie app with Azure Redis Cache in 15 minutes</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more details about how to use ASP.NET session state, see <linkText>ASP.NET Session State Overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about how to use ASP.NET session state, see <linkText>ASP.NET Session State Overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title>
